originalText.text: I cannot say enough great things about Blake and the entire DCT team. We had seen 2 trainers to no avail - our girl was anxious, reactive to so many things (dogs, people, skates), had separation anxiety, pulled SO hard on leash, and filled with endless energy that we could never expend. Our entire day was structured around her and we were worried things wouldn’t get better. After a consultation and a visit, we decided on a Board & Train at Blake’s home in Florida. Best investment we’ve made! She’s been home for a few weeks now and there’s been immense improvement. There are still a lot of things that we’re working on, but it’s been amazing to see the change. Our relationship has changed so much and it’s been so joyful to learn how to fulfill her while still maintaining our boundaries and rules. Blake and the team are SO responsive and helpful. We are incredibly grateful for this team!

originalText.text: Simply excellent. We have a rescue dog (mixed chocolate lab) who was previously abused and overbred and she was naturally very scared and skeptical of humans and other dogs. Having tried several trainers to help her, none of it seemed to work till K9 showed up. They’ve been incredible and the change in her is transformational - she’s happy to interact with others and let others touch her (which would never have happened before), co-exists with other dogs, ability to go to the vet, walks amazingly, trained in the house. K9 have been nothing but exceptional through the process with constant communication through out and keeping us up to date with progress as well as continued ongoing support even after we got back. Big shout out to Mitch who has been superb in Ruby’s training and communication and still checks in to see how she’s doing and settling back. Safe to say Ruby misses him. The place is also a fun place for the dogs. K9 take them out constantly to large open spaces outside (leisure and part of training) and there is two large facilities in the lower east side with plenty of space for dogs to play indoors and using that space for training. Ruby got her fair share of excercise and more while she was there for 6 weeks which was amazing to know. Worth following their Instagram page as it gives you a good feel for what the dogs  are up to on a daily basis (walks, training, playing). Value for money, having done extensive research, for what you’re getting and their incredible training and what you’re paying, I’d say this has yo be up there, especially with some of absurd prices I’ve seen.

originalText.text: I was very saddened when I heard our trainer Nancy was leaving Dream come true K9. She was very welcoming and professional. Over the course of past year, we have been doing private sessions with Nancy and our German shepherd Tank. Nancy taught us very much about how to be a good dog handler and how to properly train our dog showing us all the necessary techniques to always stay positive and get the best result. She was always very good at listening to what we had to say and regards to our dog’s behavior and she was very detailed about how we should counteract whenever he misbehaves. We wish her the best of luck and we will miss her very much, especially our boy Tank. Thank you Nancy!

originalText.text: LO V E the team and facility! Cannot recommend them more - would give more stars if I could. I don’t trust anyone else with my dog except the staff here at Dream Come True. Everyone here is friendly, dog-obsessed, answers any and all concerns and questions you may have, extremely professional and They. All. Know. What. They. Are. Doing. My dog’s behavior has improved immensely (with consistent training on my end too) from a couple private lessons and Train and Play twice a week. He used to be leash reactive and is much less so from the exposure and time spent with other dogs at the facility. He has pretty bad separation anxiety, but when I drop him off he rarely ever looks back when I hand the leash over. Safe to say he’s pretty pleased with DCTK9 too.

originalText.text: Blake and the DCTK9 team have significantly changed the lives of myself, my husband and our Weimaraner, Miles.  At 10 months old, our sweet, silly, docile puppy went through a traumatic experience and his behavior drastically changed.  We worked with our puppy trainer and vet and saw zero improvement, in fact, it got worse.  Miles was suddenly extremely anxious around strangers, jumping, lunging and trying to attack anyone and everyone, he was on meds to "calm him down."  I started a months-long process of finding a new trainer or specialist, trying to avoid the "last resort."  In one case, we were told our dog had "snapped" and was beyond help.  I had nearly lost hope when Miles was kicked out of yet another doggy daycare, but the owner recommend Blake.  I reached out to find out more (crying on the phone) and we decided on a 5 week board & train for Miles.  Thanks to DCTK9, my husband and I feel confident that we are building a better relationship with Miles and can control his behavior.  We are still working on his issues, but I no longer fear the "last resort."  We continuously use DCTK9 for their boarding and walking services. I'll never forget Jen, one of the trainers, returning Miles from his Meet & Greet walk, and she bent over to receive some kisses!  I thought for sure Miles was going to attack her.  It's just a testament to the entire team's knowledge of dogs and their effectiveness.  When we travel, I do not worry about Miles or any incidents occurring, since everyone on the team understands his triggers.  If you have an issue with your dog, take him to DCTK9!  They truly are the best and so worth it.
